sentences: Malcolm "Molly" Duncan (24 August 1945 â€“ 8 October 2019) was a Scottish tenor saxophonist and founding member of Average White Band.
In the late 1990s and early 2000s he collaborated with many drum and bass artists, including Intense, of which his son Dan Duncan is a member.
In July 2015,  Malcolm "Molly" Duncan, along, with Steve Ferrone and Hamish Stuart reunited to form The 360 Band.
Duncan died at his home in Bocholt, Germany on 7 October 2019, at age 74, shortly after it had been announced that he had been diagnosed with terminal cancer.
